description: The `synthetic.intercompany_transactions` table represents transactions between different accounts within the same corporate group, each identified by a unique primary key `ic_transaction_id`. It includes details such as the account involved (`ic_account_id`), the date of the transaction (`transaction_date`), the monetary value of the transaction (`amount`), and its current `status`, among other attributes. Though it contains a foreign key relationship undefined in the provided data, the table serves as a record-keeping structure for managing intercompany financial activities within the synthetic database.

columns.name: ic_transaction_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each transaction within the intercompany transactions dataset. It sequentially assigns an identifier to each transaction, ensuring distinct tracking.

columns.name: ic_account_id
columns.description: This column represents an identifier for accounts involved in intercompany transactions, ensuring unique identification of entities within the organization's internal financial exchanges.

columns.name: transaction_date
columns.description: This column represents the dates on which intercompany transactions occur, capturing specific calendar days in various years including 2024 and 2025, observed in Central Standard or Daylight Time. The purpose is to track the timing of these financial events within the organizations involved.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The column represents the transaction amounts exchanged between companies within a corporate group. Each value indicates the monetary size of a particular transaction, highlighting varying levels of intercompany financial activity.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column contains detailed narratives or insights related to various transactions involving customers, highlighting activities or events with diverse entities. Purpose unclear from available data, but it may include commentary on transaction context or specifics.

columns.name: reference_number
columns.description: This column represents unique identifiers assigned to each transaction within the intercompany transactions table. These identifiers help differentiate and track individual transactions.

columns.name: status
columns.description: This column denotes the current stage or condition of intercompany transactions, reflecting various states such as 'active', 'pending', 'completed', 'cancelled', and 'inactive'. It is used to track the transaction's lifecycle and operational status.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when an intercompany transaction was created. It is used to track the timing of each transaction's entry into the system.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the last modification date and time of intercompany transactions. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX intercompany_transactions_pkey ON synthetic.intercompany_transactions USING btree (ic_transaction_id)
